result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Djuan A Farley

records.addlTxt:
1:43 PM Defendant Djuan A Farley in court.  Prosecuting attorney Theresa Fallon Villar in court for the State of Wisconsin. DAR Court Reporter: Taryn Strickland. 
Deft would like to resolve this matter.
State puts their offer on the record.
If deft completes the TASC program, matter would be amended to an ordinance violation.
State indicates they will send the TASC info to the deft.
BTC: Matter adjourned for status.
Status conference scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on December 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:40 PM Defendant Djuan A Farley in court.  Prosecuting attorney Diane M. Donohoo in court for the State of Wisconsin. DAR Court Reporter: Taryn Strickland. 
Deft was to try and hire an atty on his own and bring back the petition for a court appointed atty.
Deft indicates he does not have that paperwork with him.
Deft would like another date to bring that back.
BTC: Matter adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

9:06 AM Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Djuan A Farley in court. DAR Court Reporter: Taryn Strickland. 
State has filed an amended complaint filed on 6-15-22.
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng.
Deft has gone to the SPD's office but does not qualify.
Court appointed atty info given to the deft.
BTC: Matter adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on September 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
copy of letter from State Public Defender - not eligible
State's Notice of Intent to introduce recorded Statements
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

***ALSO $900.00 SIGNATURE BOND*** Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

2:43 PM Prosecuting attorney Dirk Christian Jensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Djuan A Farley in court. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Based upon the complaint the State moves to modify the complaint, where as D.F in the complaint is in fact Djuan Farley. 
BTC: After consulting with the defendant, court will proceed- State to file an amended complaint prior to next date.
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
